Functions 8. (1) The functions of the Council shall be to­
ofCounoil
(a) conduct examinations;
(b) a.ward certificates or diplomas to candidates who
pass examinations conducted by the Council;
(c) carry out relevant research in examinations;
(d) advise any public institution on the development
and use of any system of testing or examining when
requested to do so;
(e) formulate syllabuses for examinations;
(/) promote the international recognition of qualifications
conferred by the Council;
g) approve or reject appointments of examiners;
(h) organise training courses for, or arrange for the training
of, examiners, markers, supervisors, invigilators and
other persons connected with exam.in& tions; and
(i) invite any person or body either in or outside Zambia
to a.saist the Council in the conduct of examinations.
(2) The Council may, by directions in writing and subject
to such term.a and conditions as it thinks fit, delegate to the
Director any of its functions under this Act.

specifci directions with respect to the discharge of its fu notion.11
